entry.title: Custom Agentic Chatbot with SAP AI Core and Joule Studio ‚Äî Part 3 (1)
entry.content:
üöÄ  Series Overview: Custom Agentic Chatbot with SAP AI Core and Joule Studio

  • Part 1 ‚Äî Building the Custom AI Agent Backend
  • Part 2 (1) ‚Äî Deploying the Agent on AI Core (Environment & Containerization)
  • Part 2 (2) ‚Äî Deploying the Agent on AI Core (Deployment & Testing)
  • Part 3 (1) ‚Äî Setting Up Joule Studio Connection (Destination & Environment)
  • Part 3 (2) ‚Äî Creating a Joule Skill (Design & Release)
  • Part 3 (3) ‚Äî Testing and Sharing on Work Zone

 

Part 3 (1) ‚Äî Setting Up Joule Studio Connection (Destination & Environment)

 

Now that your custom AI agent is deployed and running on SAP AI Core, the next step is to connect it to Joule Studio, SAP‚Äôs conversational AI workspace. In this part, you‚Äôll set up the foundation that allows Joule to communicate securely with your deployed agent.

By the end of this section, you will:

  • Create a Destination for your AI Core endpoint
  • Configure a Joule Environment for Skill deployment
  • Build and test Actions that call your backend APIs

Once these are complete, Joule will be ready to call your backend APIs, and in Part 3 (2), we‚Äôll turn those APIs into an interactive Skill you can deploy and chat with.

 

1. Create Destination

Destinations in SAP BTP act as centralized connection configurations. They store the endpoint URL, authentication details, and headers needed to connect external systems like SAP AI Core.

‚ö†Ô∏èNote: When calling SAP AI Core from Joule Studio, make sure the AI Core destination is configured in the subaccount where Joule Studio is deployed. 

  1. Go to BTP Cockpit ‚Üí Connectivity ‚Üí Destinations
  2. Click New Destination, and fill in the following details as this example:
  • Name : agent-backend
  • Type: HTTP
  • URL : https://api.<region>.aicore.cloud.sap/v2/inference/deployments/<deployment-id>
  • Authentication: OAuth2ClientCredentials
  • Client ID / Secret : From your AI Core service key
  • Token Service URL: https://<subdomain>.authentication.<region>.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token
  • AdditionalProperties
    • HTML5.DynamicDestination : true
    • AppgyverEnabled : true
    • URL.headers.AI-Resource-Group : <your-resource-group-name>
    • URL.headers.Content-Type : application/json

 

2. Create Environment for Joule Skills

In SAP Build, Environments act as workspaces where your Joule Skills will be deployed and executed.

  1.  Go to SAP Build ‚Üí Control Tower ‚Üí Environments
  2. Click Create Environment, and enter your environment name (e.g., AgenticChatbot)

This environment will host your Joule Skills, including runtime logs, variables, and deployment status.

 

3. Create Actions

In Joule Studio, Actions define how your skill communicates with external systems ‚Äî in our case, the AI agent backend deployed on SAP AI Core. Each Action corresponds to a REST API endpoint. Let‚Äôs use /v2/plan as an example. Refer to this post to see how does this endpoint looks like. 

 

Step 1. Create an Action

In Joule Studio:

  • Go to Actions ‚Üí Create Action
  • Choose Build from Scratch (or upload an OpenAPI spec if you have one)

Step 2. Define Input

Click Input tab and define what data will send to your endpoint. 

Step 3. Define Output

Next, go to the Output tab. Here, we specify the response format expected from /v2/plan. This ensures Joule knows how to parse and display the backend's response properly. 

Step 4. Test and Connection

Now, open the Test tab and click Run Test with correct destination which we set up in previous step (1. Create Destination).

If the test passes successfully, click Release ‚Üí Publish Action. Your /v2/plan endpoint is now available for use in Joule Skill as an Action.

Step 5. Repeat for Other Endpoints 

Once you‚Äôve successfully connected /v2/plan, you can repeat the process for other endpoints. Each endpoint can be defined as a separate Action, giving you modular control over the entire workflow inside Joule Studio.

 

At this point, you‚Äôve completed all the backend connectivity steps, from creating destinations to validating the API in action. The groundwork is done.

üëâ  Next, we‚Äôll move to the fun part: turning this API into an interactive Joule Skill that we can use from chat interface. Let‚Äôs continue in Part 3 (2) Creating a Joule Skill (Design & Release).

entry.title: Custom Agentic Chatbot with SAP AI Core and Joule Studio ‚Äî Part 3 (2)
entry.content:
üöÄ Series Overview: Custom Agentic Chatbot with SAP AI Core and Joule Studio

  • Part 1 ‚Äî Building the Custom AI Agent Backend
  • Part 2 (1) ‚Äî Deploying the Agent on AI Core (Environment & Containerization)
  • Part 2 (2) ‚Äî Deploying the Agent on AI Core (Deployment & Testing)
  • Part 3 (1) ‚Äî Setting Up Joule Studio Connection (Destination & Environment)
  • Part 3 (2) ‚Äî Creating a Joule Skill (Design & Release)
  • Part 3 (3) ‚Äî Testing and Sharing on Work Zone

 

Part 3 (2) ‚Äî Creating a Joule Skill (Design & Release)

 

In the previous part, we connected Joule Studio to our AI Core backend and tested the Action successfully. Now, it‚Äôs time to make it conversational. Now, we‚Äôll design the full conversational flow inside Joule Studio by creating a CustomAgent Skill that links together multiple backend actions

By the end of this section, you will:

  • Create a new Skill in Joule Studio
  • Configure its input parameters and message responses
  • Chain multiple Actions to form a complete conversational logic

Once the skill design is complete, we‚Äôll move on in Part 3 (3) to test it live in the Joule Chat Interface and deploy it to Work Zone for organization-wide access.

 

1. Create a Joule Skill

A Skill defines how Joule interprets user messages and which Actions to trigger in response. We'll now create a skill that connects your actions including /v2/plan action, so that the Joule chat interface can activate this skill and communicate seamlessly with your deployed AI Core backend. 

Step 1. Open the Lobby

Go to SAP Build Lobby ‚Üí Create ‚Üí Joule Skill. Name it something like Custom Agent, this will act as the main entry point of your agent. 

‚öôÔ∏è  Note: In Joule Studio, skills can be nested. Simply create your new skill inside that existing context.

Step 2. Define Skill Details

In the General tab, fill in the following fields as below example:

  • Name: CustomAgent
  • Description: A skill to activate custom agent. Activate this skill if user's request contains "/CustomAgent".

üí°  Tip: Use an explicit activation phrase (like /CustomAgent) to ensure the skill consistently triggers only when intended, making testing smoother and more predictable.

Also configure the toggles as follows:

  • Allow Joule to generate a response: Off ‚Üí You‚Äôll use ‚ÄúSend Message‚Äù steps instead.
  • Allow skill to be started directly by a user: On ‚Üí Enables direct triggering from the Joule chat interface.

 

Step 4. Configure Skill Parameters

Next, go to the Parameters tab and define the input variables that your skill will use.
For example:

  • conversation_id : Used to track continuous dialogue sessions (if not provided, the backend will start a new one)
  • message : The user‚Äôs actual input message

When parameters are defined at the skill level, Joule automatically parses values from the user‚Äôs chat input and makes them available as variables in subsequent nodes. This means you can reference them directly in your Action or Message nodes.

For example:

  • Use {{message}} when passing the user input to the to the /v2/plan or /v2/action-graph endpoint
  • Use {{conversation_id}} to maintain session context in AI Core side between user turns

You can also reuse the output of a previous Action in later nodes. For instance, if your /v2/plan Action returns a JSON object, its fields (like {{plan.content}}) can be referenced directly in the next Action or Send Message node. This lets your Joule Skill behave like a data pipeline, passing both user inputs and Action results through the workflow.

 

üóí  Example: Using Action Outputs in Message Nodes

This example below shows a  Message Configuration example where the output of the /v2/plan Action is referenced in the response message.

  • ${context.joule_action_...result.conversation_id} ‚Üí retrieves the conversation_id returned by the Action
  • ${context.joule_action_...result.content} ‚Üí displays the generated plan content returned by the Action
  • ${context.joule_action_...result.timestamp} ‚Üí shows the response time returned by the Action

 

Now that you‚Äôve seen how each Action and Message node exchanges data, let‚Äôs look at the entire Skill flow that ties them all together.

 

‚õì  CustomAgent skill flow design

This mechanism allows you to chain multiple Actions and build a natural, multi-step conversation flow such as:

/v2/plan ‚Üí /v2/action-graph ‚Üí /v2/start-execution ‚Üí /v2/continue-execution

Each Action node represents a backend call, while the Message nodes in between provide real-time feedback so users can monitor progress ‚Äî for example, confirming when the plan is created or when the execution starts.

To ensure a continuous and contextual conversation, each API call passes a shared conversation_id variable. This allow different endpoint (such as /v2/plan, /v2/action-graph, and /v2/continue-execution) to recognize they belong to the same dialogue session, maintaining conversation state consistently across multiple backend actions. 

When the user sends the same conversation_id in subsequent chats, the agent can continue the dialogue seamlessly from the previous state, effectively enabling multi-turn conversations across different endpoints. We'll demonstrate this continuous conversation flow in the next post.

 

Step 5. Release & Deploy Skill

Once the design is complete, click Release ‚Üí Create Version ‚Üí Deploy to your Environment.
After deployment, the skill becomes active in your Joule Studio environment, meaning it can now be invoked from the Joule Chat interface.

 

At this stage, your CustomAgent Skill has been fully structured - from defining parameters and linking actions to designing message nodes that visualize each execution step. You‚Äôve established the orchestration flow that allows Joule Studio to interact seamlessly with your AI Core agent.

üëâIn the next post, Part 3 (3): Testing and Sharing the Skill on Work Zone, we‚Äôll put this flow into action - testing real conversations, validating responses, and share your skill to Work Zone so users can access it as a live enterprise chatbot.

entry.title: Joule Skill for Maintenance Order Management in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Disclaimer: This blog is created to showcase the Joule Skills feature in SAP and is intended for demonstration purposes only. The content is not meant for productive use.

This use case demonstrates the creation and deployment of Joule Skills in SAP Build to manage Maintenance Orders in SAP S/4HANA. By leveraging APIs from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, the solution enables users to create, update, and retrieve maintenance orders through natural language interactions in Joule. The setup involves configuring input parameters, mapping them to action calls, and formatting responses, all while securely connecting the SAP BTP environment to the on-premise SAP S/4HANA system via Cloud Connector. This provides a seamless, conversational interface for maintenance order management, highlighting the capabilities of Joule Skills for process automation and intelligent interaction.

Prerequisite

  1. Establish a secure tunnel between the SAP BTP subaccount and the on-premise SAP S/4HANA system in Cloud connector. This allows the Joule skill to communicate with backend services (such as the Maintenance Order APIs) hosted in the on-premise system.
  2. After configuring the Cloud Connector to establish connectivity between the SAP BTP environment and the on-premise SAP S/4HANA system, the next step is to create a destination in the BTP subaccount.
    This destination acts as a connection point that allows applications (such as Joule skills or process automation projects) to call on-premise APIs securely through the Cloud Connector.

Begin by creating a custom action and selecting the required API from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. This API will be integrated into the Joule Skill to enable Maintenance Order Management through action calls. Once the action is created, choose the available operations. For this demonstration, the Maintenance Order ‚Äì POST, UPDATE, and PATCH methods are used to perform create, update, and retrieve functions. After adding these actions, test each one using the test feature and select the destination configured in the BTP cockpit.

 

In SAP Build Lobby, create a Joule Skills project and provide a suitable description for the skill. For example:

Create individual Joule skills for Maintenance Order ‚Äì POST/UPDATE and PATCH operations.

Create Maintenance Orders

Set up the input parameters for this Joule Skill, which will be used in the prompt during the demo of maintenance order creation from Joule. Next, create a destination variable to ensure the destination is correctly mapped upon project deployment. Map all necessary values from the input parameters to the respective inputs of the action call used for creating a maintenance order. Finally, proceed to the last step to format the response in Joule using the ‚ÄòSend Message‚Äô option.

Get Maintenance Order ‚Äì Joule Skill

Change Maintenance Order ‚Äì Joule Skill (Same as above)

After this release and deploy the project in the environment.Once deployed the version is reflected and launch the Joule

So by deploying the created joule skills we now have this feature by using natural language.

In conclusion, this demonstration highlights how Joule Skills in SAP Build can simplify Maintenance Order Management by enabling intuitive, natural language interactions with SAP S/4HANA. Through seamless integration using the Cloud Connector and APIs from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, business users can efficiently create, update, and retrieve maintenance orders without navigating complex interfaces.

Demo Link

entry.title: New Expert-Guided Implementation: Unlocking Joule and SAP Business AI from Strategy to Activation
entry.content:
As organizations look to harness the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to drive transformation, SAP Business AI stands at the forefront - embedding intelligence directly into business processes to deliver smarter decisions and measurable outcomes.

From finance and supply chain to HR, procurement, and customer experience, SAP Business AI infuses trusted, relevant, and responsible AI across every process - ensuring each insight is contextual, every recommendation actionable, and every outcome aligned with enterprise goals.

Whether leveraging Joule, SAP‚Äôs AI copilot, or AI-embedded scenarios across your SAP applications, your path to becoming an intelligent and sustainable enterprise begins with understanding and activating SAP‚Äôs Business AI capabilities.

To help you unlock this value faster, we‚Äôre launching a new Expert-Guided Implementation (EGI): 

Unlocking AI: Joule and SAP Business AI from Strategy to Activation

This multi-day, expert-led workshop is designed to help you and your team unlock the full potential of Joule and SAP Business AI across your SAP landscape. Guided by SAP experts, you‚Äôll explore how to translate strategy into execution with practical exercises, live demonstrations, and activation guidance.

Workshop Schedule

To accommodate global participants, this session will be offered in two time zones:

  • October 20‚Äì22, 2025 | 10:00am‚Äì12:00pm EMEA time zone

  • November 3‚Äì5, 2025 | 10:00am ‚Äì12:00pm NY time zone


What You‚Äôll Learn

Through this EGI, participants will gain hands-on experience and actionable knowledge in:

  • SAP Business AI Strategy & Foundation - Understand SAP‚Äôs AI vision, architecture, and trusted approach to delivering responsible, embedded intelligence
  • Commercial Model & AI Units - Learn how to navigate Base vs Premium models, the AI Feature Catalog, and use the AI Estimator to plan your adoption journey
  • Joule ‚Äì AI Built for Business - Explore Joule‚Äôs unified architecture, roadmap, and capabilities across Joule for Business, Joule for Developers, and Joule for Consultants
  • S/4HANA AI & ML Capabilities - Experience ISLM in action through AI/ML demo use cases designed to enhance decision-making and process automation
  • SAP BTP AI & ML Capabilities - Discover how BTP AI Foundation, Document AI, AI Services, AI Core, and AI Launchpad can help you extend and scale innovation
  • Joule Activation & Prerequisites - Gain a clear view of activation steps, prerequisites, and how to extend Joule with Document Grounding, Joule Studio, and AI Agents

Why Attend

This workshop goes beyond theory‚Äîit‚Äôs interactive, practical, and guided by SAP experts. By the end, you‚Äôll have:

  • A clear understanding of SAP‚Äôs Business AI strategy and product portfolio
  • The ability to activate Joule and deploy AI scenarios across your landscape
  •  Actionable steps to integrate AI and Generative AI into your business workflows
  • Insights into commercial models and AI unit management for smarter planning

Whether you‚Äôre a business leader shaping AI strategy or a technical consultant implementing it, this EGI equips you to bridge the gap between strategy and execution.

How to Register

üëâ Register here to secure your spot* today to learn from SAP experts and gain the skills to bring Business AI to life across your enterprise.

 * You may need to register your S-user for access to SAP Learning Hub to access the EGI registration page.  It is a one-time registration, click here.

entry.title: SAP Joule for Developers Expands to Private Cloud: Accelerating ABAP Innovation and Transformation
entry.content:
Key Highlights

  • Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities are now available in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition 2025.
  • New Custom Code Migration capabilities accelerate the transformation of classic ERP code to S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, including:
    • Documentation Chat - Get accurate answers on SAP S/4HANA simplifications.
    • ABAP Program Explain - Understand the business purpose and logic of legacy code.
    • Explain for SAP S/4HANA Test Cockpit Issues - Diagnose and resolve S/4HANA-related Test Cockpit issues using context from simplification items and cookbooks.

Earlier this year, SAP introduced Joule for Developers ‚Äî a set of embedded artificial intelligence capabilities in SAP Build, including ABAP, that helps developers accelerate application and extension development, reduce costs, and boost productivity.

Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities are now available for S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition, version 2025, providing comprehensive support for ABAP Cloud use cases. The release also introduces the first Custom Code Migration capabilities, bringing a powerful suite of AI-assisted capabilities purpose-built for ABAP development and cloud delivery.

Best of all, Joule for Developers remains free of charge, enabling customers and partners to integrate it into daily operations and accelerate innovation without commercial barriers.

 

What‚Äôs Included

This release for Private Cloud delivers AI-powered support for the core development scenarios ABAP developers rely on every day. Key capabilities include:

  • inline code completion,
  • ABAP/CDS code explanation,
  • automated unit test generation for ABAP and ABAP core data services (CDS),
  • RAP business objects generation,
  • RAP predictive business logic, and
  • OData consumption.

All capabilities are designed to accelerate development, improve code quality, and boost productivity from day one. Additionally, this release introduces the first wave of Custom Code Migration capabilities, designed to accelerate the move from classic SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Cloud Edition. These AI-powered features simplify code analysis and adaptation by:

  • Providing Documentation Chat for quick answers on SAP S/4HANA simplifications:

 

  • Using ABAP Program Explain to clarify the business purpose and implementation logic of legacy code:

 

  • Explaining ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) findings with step-by-step guidance on how to fix the issues, based on simplification items and technical documentation:

 

All capabilities are designed to reduce manual effort, speed up migration projects, and help your teams to modernize their ABAP landscapes with great confidence.

The ABAP AI software development kit, powered by Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management, is now available and offers centralized access to the generative AI hub in SAP AI Core. It leverages the same robust platform SAP uses internally, delivering proven, production-grade infrastructure to customer landscapes. With simplified configuration and governance, development teams can adopt AI capabilities quickly, providing a significant boost to integration efforts.

 

Why This Matters

Private cloud customers require strict governance, security, and operational control - yet they also seek the speed and innovation modern AI-driven development delivers. This release addresses both priorities by enabling:

  • faster development cycles with AI-assisted coding and test generation,
  • stronger knowledge transfer through automated code explanations and copilot interactions,
  • higher delivery quality with automated testing and code migration support, and
  • secure innovation within controlled environments.

 

Looking Ahead

We‚Äôre building on this momentum with a series of targeted deliveries aligned to upcoming releases across the BTP ABAP Environment and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Planned updates for BTP ABAP Environment 2511, 2602, and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602 include:

  • documentation generation capabilities,
  • enhanced explanations for reports in the Custom Code Migration application,
  • AI-enabled insights on Clean Core‚Äìrelated ATC findings directly within the Custom Code Migration application,
  • code migration and adaptation proposals to support developers working on RISE code adaptation,
  • ABAP CDS annotation and metadata extension generation, and
  • ABAP CDS analytical model generation.

These enhancements will extend Joule‚Äôs impact beyond code completion and test generation, supporting documentation, migration and Clean Core compliance, analytical use cases, and addressing more stages of the end-to-end development lifecycle.

 

Free Offer Extended

SAP Joule for Developers will remain free of charge. The extended promotion ensures that all customers and partners can continue to use Joule for Developers capabilities for free.

Access can be requested using the material numbers 8019124 (customers) and 8019541 (TDD partners). This offer now extends beyond the BTP ABAP environment and SAP Cloud ERP Public Edition to include SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition customers running the latest 2025 release.

 

Closing Remarks

SAP Joule for Developers‚Äô delivery for Private Cloud is a significant milestone ‚Äî combining end-to-end ABAP Cloud with AI use cases, innovative code migration scenarios, and a standardized ABAP AI SDK to bring practical AI assistance directly into everyday development workflows.

With extended free of charge access, we invite every customer and partner to explore SAP Joule for Developers, push its boundaries, and help shape the future of AI-assisted ABAP development.

Start using SAP Joule for Developers today and join us in building the next generation of intelligent, AI-driven ABAP innovation.

For a deeper dive, read the blog post by Simona Marincei, head of ABAP AI.

Learn more about SAP Joule for Developers capabilities here.

entry.title: SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025
entry.content:
Hi folks,

SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities are now also available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025.
The ABAP AI license materials for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 are the same as for SAP BTP ABAP Environment & SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. For more information, please check out the following SAP Note 3571857.

Below, you can find a step-by-step guide on how to activate SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 system.

Have fun and stay tuned for TechEd soon!

Best,
Sebastian

 

Prerequisites

You have a customer account on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and a development system on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 and you have prepared the following:

  • Subscription to SAP Cloud Identity Services
  • Subscription to SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities
  • Established trust to your SAP Cloud Identity Services tenant in your BTP Subaccount, see this link
  • Your user needs Administrator access to your SAP Cloud Identity Services tenant
  • Your system needs to be configured so that it trusts server certificates according to the "required" section of the BTP Trust Store.
  • Your system needs to use a client certificate issued by a CA listed in the "required" section of the BTP Trust Store. One way to obtain a client certificate can be found on Manage Destination Certificates (under "Generate a Certificate").
  • You've successfully applied SAP Note 3627794 .
  • Your ABAP system needs to support TLS 1.3. If TLS 1.3 is not enabled, refer to SAP Note 3318423  to activate it.

 

Configuration steps in your SAP BTP subaccount

  1. In your BTP subaccount, navigate to Entitlements. You‚Äôll see a table with all entitlements it already has.
  2. Select Configure Entitlements > Add Service Plans. A popover appears with all entitlements available for your directory/subaccount.
  3. Select the service SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities and then the plan ‚Äúdefault‚Äù
  4. Select the amount of quota
  5. Select Add Service Plans.
  6. Select Save.

 

  1. Navigate to your subaccount in the SAP BTP cockpit
  2. Go to Services > Service Marketplace.
  3. Choose the SAP Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities tile.
  4. Choose Create and select Plan default




  5. Once the service is created, go to your IAS and navigate to Users & Authorizations > Groups
  6. Check that the group j4d-admin was successfully created
  7. Add your admin user to the created j4a-admin group

     

  8. Navigate to your subaccount in the SAP BTP cockpit
  9. In the navigation go to Services >Instances & Subscriptions
  10. Choose the SAP Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities tile.
  11. Click on Go to Application




  12. Maintain Certificate Mappings app should be opened



    Configuration steps in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 system

    1. Go to your ABAP system, open the transaction APPLDESTCC
    2. Select scenario HTTP - Application Destination and click on Execute


    3. Next, select AIC_ADT_HTTP_PROXY and open the context menu. Choose Create New Application Destination. Now, you're asked to enter the details of your application destination.


       



    4. Enter an Application Destination Name of your choice and select the check mark. 



    5. Now, first enter a Description and select the checkboxes Active and Default.

    6. Fill in the information in the Technical Settings tab:
      1. Target System Settings: In the Host field, enter https://proxy.<your region>.hub.j4a.services.sap. As Protocol, select HTTPS.
      2. (Optional) HTTP Proxy Options: This information is not mandatory.

        Note The region you enter in https://proxy.<your region>.hub.j4a.services.sap must be the same region (not technical key) that you chose for your subaccount, for example "eu10". See Regions and API Endpoints for the ABAP Environment


         

    7. Choose the Logon tab
      1. General Settings: Select Connection to External Server.
      2. Logon Procedure: Select Client Certificate and choose the certificate you wish to use from the dropdown menu
      3. Select Save. You've successfully maintained the connection.



    8. Now, continue in your subaccount in the SAP BTP Cockpit
      1. Select the SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities subscription you have just created (see Subscribing to SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities), or open its details and select Go to Application. You are forwarded to the Maintain Certificate Mappings page.
      2. In the Certificate Mappings section, select Create to receive a one-time password (OTP).
      3. Copy the OTP.

        Note: the OTP is valid for five minutes. If you need a new one, close the pop-up and click on Create again.


    9.  Go to your corresponding ABAP system and run report AIC_ADT_PROXY_CERTIFICATE. Select Execute.
      1. Paste the one-time password that you've copied in the previous step
      2. (Optional) If you wish to use a new certificate that you haven't used in step 1, select Use Custom SSL Client PSE ID. Click in the Client PSE ID field and choose the new certificate from the value help. Now, you can go back to step 1 and switch to the new certificate.
      3. Select Execute



      4. You've successfully registered your certificate!


         

    10. You can now create a new ABAP Project in ADT (using its latest version) and check out SAP Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities

entry.title: Get Ready for ASUG Tech Connect 2025 in Louisville: Don‚Äôt Miss Our Sessions and Innovations
entry.content:
ASUG Tech Connect is just around the corner, taking place November 4‚Äì6, 2025 in Louisville, Kentucky. This is your opportunity to stay ahead of the curve, connect with SAP executives and experts, and gain first-hand insights into the latest technologies shaping the future of business.

Customer Support & Cloud Lifecycle Management will be at the heart of the event‚Äîwith seven sessions led by our leaders, customers, and experts, plus two dedicated booths in the SAP area:

  • SAP Cloud ALM booth ‚Äì everything you need to know about implementation, operations, and transformation with SAP Cloud ALM.

  • Customer Support & SAP for Me booth ‚Äì discover how SAP is leveraging agentic AI, AI, and LLMs to transform customer support and deliver seamless experiences.

üëâWe‚Äôre frontrunners at SAP in applying these innovations, and ASUG Tech Connect is your chance to see them in action.

 

Don‚Äôt Miss These Sessions

November 4, 2025 | 11:15 AM ‚Äì 11:55 AM ET

Meijer‚Äôs AI Playbook: Resilience and Readiness for Peak Retail Moments
Join Meijer‚Äôs Srinivassan Ramamurthy, ASUG‚Äôs Geoff Scott, and SAP‚Äôs Stefan Steinle to explore how AI-powered readiness safeguards business-critical operations. Hear how Meijer ensures peak performance during high-demand periods, prevents risks before they impact, and turns seasonal pressure into a strategic advantage.
Speakers: Srinivassan Ramamurthy, Geoff Scott, Stefan Steinle

November 5, 2025 | 8:00 AM ‚Äì 8:50 AM ET

Transition from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM
Moving from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM? Explore the tools and best practices to ensure a smooth transition, including the ‚ÄúTransition to SAP Cloud ALM‚Äù roadmap, SAP Readiness Check, and selective data transfer tools.
Speakers: Umesh Jagadesh, Vijay Prakash

November 5, 2025 | 11:20 AM ‚Äì 12:10 PM ET

Using AI and Data-Driven Insights for a Smooth Customer Support Experience
See how autonomous agents, generative self-services, and intelligent automation are transforming SAP support experiences today and shaping the future with AI.
Speakers: Mohammed Ajouz, Alice Petrovich

November 5, 2025 | 1:00 PM ‚Äì 3:00 PM ET

Hands-on Lab: How to Start Transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private
Get guidance from the SAP Business Transformation Center and SAP Cloud ALM on moving to SAP Cloud ERP Private. Explore approaches, trusted advisor support, and integrated tools for a smooth journey.
Speakers: Thorsten Spihlmann, Kristin Aleksandrova, Jacqueline Hirsch, Oliver Huschke

November 5, 2025 | 1:50 PM ‚Äì 2:30 PM ET

SAP for Me is your personalized portal for insights and transparency. Learn how to monitor systems, access tailored recommendations, and upskill with guided learning.
Speakers: Mohammed Ajouz, Alice Petrovich

Adopt a Clean Core with SAP Cloud ALM and Extensions Built on SAP BTP
Learn how SAP Cloud ALM orchestrates the clean core journey with SAP BTP Best Practices. Manage requirements, testing, and release processes while staying current with innovation.
Speakers: Deepti Patil, Tim Steuer

November 6, 2025 | 4:15 PM ‚Äì 5:05 PM ET

Streamlining Transformation with SAP Cloud ALM, SAP LeanIX, and SAP Signavio
This session will explore how SAP LeanIX, SAP Signavio and SAP Cloud ALM enable organizations to drive smarter decision-making and accelerate digital transformation projects.

Make It Part of Your Agenda

ASUG Tech Connect is about learning, connecting, and co-innovating. We encourage you to:

  • Register today if you haven‚Äôt already.

  • Add our sessions to your personal agenda to secure your seat.

We look forward to seeing you in Louisville this November‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss the chance to connect with our executives and experts, and experience how SAP is shaping the future of enterprise support with Cloud ALM, SAP for Me, and AI.

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights
entry.content:
Welcome to the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights! In this blog, we will journey through the latest advancements of this pivotal update.

This release brings together strategy, innovation, and intelligence ‚Äì uniting applications, data, and AI to help organizations transform how they operate and compete.

To get an overview of my personal highlights, you are welcome to watch my highlight video below.

 

 

Realizing our vision by bringing together apps, data, and AI

Whether it's refining finance with advanced AI agents, optimizing supply chain logistics, or advancing service management, each feature aims to enable agility and operational resilience. This release brings SAP's data strategy to life across applications, data integration and Business AI capabilities to empower businesses for the next leap. With AI at the top, SAP Business Data Cloud at the core, and deeply integrated applications as the foundation, organizations gain real-time insights, operational agility, and the ability to adapt and grow.

Our intelligent, modular, and configurable system is lifting ERP operations by placing people and roles at the forefront, surrounded by AI capabilities and intelligent agents. The integration with SAP Business Data Cloud enables organizations to unify and govern all SAP and third-party data, unlocking over 100 curated data products for richer insights and smarter decisions.

This update delivers innovations and enhancements across every line of business ‚Äì from Finance and Sourcing and Procurement to Manufacturing, Sales, and Service. 

In the sections that follow, we‚Äôll explore how these intelligent capabilities are enabling transformation across your ERP operations. 

 

Unleashing intelligence: SAP business AI and Joule AI agents at the forefront

Finance: Streamlining account receivables with Joule agent

In the area of Finance, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces the beta version of the Joule agent for Accounts Receivables, contributing to financial management by streamlining overdue receivables analysis. Acting as a virtual assistant, the agent swiftly identifies overdue payments, provides detailed summaries, and recommends actionable next steps, transforming traditional analysis into strategic decision-making. It offers comprehensive insights into outstanding balances, open invoices, and disputes, empowering finance teams to improve cash flow management and reduce risk. This innovation allows accountants to focus on proactive financial strategies, enhancing operational efficiency. Stay tuned for the general availability release of this game-changing tool.

 For more details, visit the SAP Help Portal and check out our demo video below.

 

Supply Chain: Optimized warehouse operations with AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning

Speaking of the Supply Chain area, SAP Cloud ERP Private's AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning is enhancing warehouse operations by addressing labor shortages and rising delivery demands with greater confidence. Imagine your warehouse managers equipped to forecast short- and mid-term workload changes using both historical and real-time data. This innovative solution allows for precise planning of resources and workloads, improving efficiency in managing outbound delivery orders.

The tool provides seamless access to interactive charts and key performance indicators (KPIs), helping managers to monitor, analyze, and anticipate labor demand. Integrated with SAP Smart Business, it leverages AI to offer forecasts on planned and future workloads, enabling supervisors to better plan shifts, enhance transparency, and minimize potential delays. As a result, businesses boost customer satisfaction by ensuring timely delivery fulfillment.

 For more details on this solution, visit the SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

Service Management: Equipment insights with Joule

In Service Management area, gaining a 360¬∞ view of equipment life cycles can transform your operational approach. With Joule integration, managers can assess equipment details, warranty information, and active service transactions, gaining insights into both customer and vendor warranties. AI-generated summaries capture the nuances of parts replaced and recurring issues, while offering recommendations for proactive management. This depth of information empowers service managers to make informed decisions, streamline operations, and enhance overall equipment effectiveness.

For more details, visit the SAP Help Portal and check out our demo video below.

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement: Purchase requisitions with AI-powered assistance

In the Sourcing and Procurement space, we are happy to introduce AI-assisted self-service requisitioning, simplifying the way purchase requisitions are created. Imagine casual users effortlessly engaging with Joule, an intuitive assistant that streamlines data entry and intelligently interprets misspelled information. This makes the requisition process accessible and user-friendly, eliminating the need for extensive navigation through multiple interfaces. Beyond just simplifying data input, Joule also leverages advanced language processing to understand and facilitate requests in diverse user languages, enhancing accuracy and efficiency. As a glimpse into the future, speech recognition promises to further reduce complexity, while simultaneously supporting purchasers by identifying sources of supply swiftly and minimizing reliance on free text items.

 Eager to learn more? Consult our SAP Help Portal.

 

Sales: Resolving sales order fulfillment challenges with AI assistance

In the sales area, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces an AI-assisted sales order fulfillment process with Joule, designed to seamlessly address delivery, invoice, and supply challenges. Imagine having an assistant that not only identifies but explains the intricacies of fulfillment issues, spanning incomplete data, credit holds, billing discrepancies, and trade compliance blocks. As questions arise, Joule provides clear, AI-generated explanations of interconnected issues, displayed in an intuitive carousel format. Beyond resolving queries, it supports inquiries about supply chain and invoicing problems, as well as journal entry creation, making the entire process more transparent and manageable. This innovative tool streamlines sales operations, ensuring smoother transactions and greater clarity.

For further insights, explore the SAP Help Portal.

Now, let‚Äôs explore further innovations of the current release across various lines of business.

 

Turning data into value: A unified data foundation with SAP Business Data Cloud

In today‚Äôs enterprise landscape, data is the engine of transformation. With SAP Business Data Cloud, organizations can unify and govern their most valuable data ‚Äì across SAP and third-party sources ‚Äì enabling real-time insights and smarter decisions at every level. 

 

A unified data foundation for every business need

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 delivers seamless integration with SAP Business Data Cloud, providing a governed, harmonized data layer that supports analytics, planning, and AI-driven innovation. This foundation breaks down silos and ensures that leaders have access to trusted, business-ready data. 

For more information, consult our page on integration with SAP Business Data Cloud.

Industry-ready data products

The release introduces a broad set of data products tailored for diverse business scenarios:

  • Convergent invoicing: Data products for billing requests, plans, and documents enable near-real-time analytics and interactive dashboards.
  • Contract accounting: Rich data products for contract accounts, provider contracts, and accounting documents support deeper financial analysis.
  • Subscription management: Data products for subscription orders, contracts, and agreements provide actionable insights for recurring revenue models.
  • Manufacturing: Unified manufacturing data ‚Äì such as production orders, confirmations, and work centers ‚Äì empowers leaders to optimize operations. Eager to learn more on manufacturing data products? Consult our SAP Help portal.
  • Product lifecycle management: Enhanced data products for bills of material, engineering change masters, and change records drive better product and change management. For more information, click here.

For the information on all released data products, please refer to Business Accelerator Hub. 

 

From data to action: Working capital dashboard

A standout example is the working capital dashboard for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud. By leveraging harmonized data from finance, procurement, and supply chain, this dashboard gives finance leaders real-time visibility into cash flow, receivables, and payables ‚Äì enabling proactive, data-driven decisions to optimize working capital.

 

SAP Business Data Cloud is not just a technology layer ‚Äì it‚Äôs the strategic enabler that turns data into value, powering the next wave of business transformation.

 

Strengthening the core: Innovations in business applications

 

Finance

Taulia: Contributing to cash flow and supply chain resilience 

Additionally, SAP Cloud ERP Private's integration with SAP Taulia benefits cash flow optimization and supply chain resilience. By leveraging real-time data insights, businesses enhance cash management and strengthen supplier relationships, allowing precise management of early payments and discounts. This boosts liquidity, enabling reinvestment in growth while maintaining supply chain stability. The integration streamlines financial processes, fostering transparency and a robust dialogue between buyers and suppliers. Empowered to manage cash flow proactively and reduce risks, organizations achieve greater agility and resilience.

 For more insights, explore SAP Help Portal.

 

Supply Chain

Streamlining order management with aATP Innovation

The current release introduces important enhancements to the Advanced Available-to-Promise (aATP) capabilities, designed to make order management more intelligent and efficient. These capabilities aim to instill confidence in order confirmations while simultaneously reducing inventory carrying costs, delivering tangible business benefits from the outset.

Picture a business environment where timely delivery is key to customer satisfaction and brand reputation. The new features enable companies to confirm orders with confidence, capitalizing on advanced backorder processing. This flexibility allows users to bypass traditional constraints such as Product Availability Check (PAC), Product Allocation (PAL), and Supply Protection (SUP). As a result, businesses can reliably and accurately fulfill customer needs, ensuring the loyalty that comes from dependable service.

The innovation further streamlines logistics by automating transport order creation, facilitating the smooth movement of stock from substitute locations to the requested site. This automation reduces the need for manual intervention, minimizing errors, and promoting a seamless logistics process. Imagine the operational relief this brings, letting companies dedicate resources to strategic tasks rather than repetitive logistics management.

By introducing efficient availability checks for configured and long products, businesses achieve effective inventory management. This ensures readiness aligns perfectly with demand, paving the way for higher fulfillment rates and precise delivery dates, enhancing overall customer satisfaction.

Additionally, we are happy to introduce the Alternative-Based Confirmation with Stock Transport Document Creation, a feature designed to streamline and improve logistical processes. This innovation allows businesses to consolidate shipments by ensuring that sales order items ship from the originally requested location rather than alternative stock-holding sites. This is particularly beneficial in maintaining a consistent supply chain, reducing the chances of logistical errors.

In the context of international shipping, this feature proves invaluable. It ensures goods are consolidated at locations best suited for tariff and tax declarations, thereby facilitating smoother, compliant export processes. Companies can navigate complex export requirements more confidently, knowing that their logistical operations support rather than hinder compliance.

 

Activation of this feature is notably flexible, accommodating various sales order characteristics. It automates stock reservations and generates necessary transportation documents as the orders are saved, reducing the manual workload associated with these tasks. This automation enhances the accuracy of transportation planning and scheduling, ensuring that these tasks align perfectly with business needs.

Eager to learn more? Consult this dedicated page  on SAP Help portal.

 

Service Management

Enhancing internal logistics: Optimized management of in-house service objects

Additionally, we are introducing a noteworthy advancement with the intracompany logistics feature for in-house service objects. This functionality empowers businesses to efficiently manage service objects within the same company code, enhancing logistical operations and resource utilization. It allows for the seamless transfer of an in-house service object between plants or storage locations, utilizing existing customer stock effectively. This capability not only optimizes space and resources but also streamlines internal logistics processes, ensuring service objects are handled with increased precision.

Businesses can now define and display the plant and storage locations of service objects, providing clearer visibility and control over inventory management. Furthermore, receiving service objects is made more efficient through the introduction of options to receive them directly via inbound delivery. This directly addresses the need for improved logistical coordination within companies, facilitating a more synchronized workflow when handling service objects.

Choosing between customer stock B and returns order stock E offers flexibility in how service objects are managed based on specific business requirements. The graphical process flow provides access to logistics-related documents, helping users quickly ascertain the status and movement of service objects. Additionally, receiving service objects at specified plant or storage locations, and reviewing their current location on the UI, enhances day-to-day operational efficiency and accuracy.

For more details, explore the SAP Help portal.

 

Driving agility: Real-time service management with enhanced service transactions

In today's dynamic business environment, flexibility is paramount for companies looking to stay competitive. In the current release, we introduce one more subtle yet powerful enhancement to service management area: the integration of plant and storage location fields within service transaction items. This advancement isn‚Äôt just a technical upgrade; it's a strategic lever for businesses aiming to enhance their operational agility.

Imagine a scenario where your company needs to rapidly adjust service delivery due to sudden market changes or resource constraints. With these new capabilities, changing the plant and storage location directly in service transactions becomes seamless, enabling you to adapt your logistics in real-time. This flexibility means that resources can be reallocated swiftly, improving response times and aligning services more closely with customer expectations.

Such adaptability transforms how businesses manage their logistics, turning service operations into a strategic advantage rather than a mere necessity. The ability to dynamically adjust service parameters according to evolving business needs not only streamlines processes but also ensures that service delivery remains efficient and customer-centric.

To dive into further details, don‚Äôt hesitate to explore the SAP Help portal page.

 

Asset Management

Streamlined maintenance strategies: Enhancing asset health

In the realm of asset management, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces the beta version of enhancements with Maintenance Planner and Maintenance Order Management, integrating seamlessly with Joule to improve how maintenance is orchestrated. Consider a planner working hand-in-hand with an intelligent agent, dynamically analyzing real-time data to fine-tune maintenance schedules and improve asset health. Joule leverages technical object details to create maintenance planning buckets, offering planners a clear view of upcoming events and enabling seamless assignment of orders and notifications. Additionally, by checking available slots and reserving production capacities for future operations, downtime is minimized, fostering a more proactive maintenance approach. This integrated system not only optimizes workflows but empowers teams to make informed decisions, ensuring that assets remain in prime condition.

For more details, explore the SAP Help Portal.

 

Optimizing asset management: Tailored efficiency in maintenance operations

In the asset management landscape, SAP Cloud ERP Private enhances the ‚ÄúManage Maintenance Orders‚Äù app to empower businesses with greater efficiency and customization. Imagine a streamlined operation where you effortlessly customize fields and processes to fit your unique needs. This app now allows batch editing of maintenance orders and the inclusion of multiple task lists, simplifying complex workflows and maximizing resource utilization. Picture the ease of linking business partners directly to orders, ensuring transparency and fostering stronger collaborations. This enhanced visibility ensures smoother communication and stronger partnerships, ultimately leading to improved service delivery and outcomes.

Interested to learn more? Click here!

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement

Precision in procurement: Elevating efficiency with synchronized service timelines

In the context of SAP procurement, timing is everything. SAP Cloud ERP Private‚Äôs latest enhancement allows for seamless transfer of lean service start and end dates to connected backend systems, shifting the focus from traditional delivery dates to precise service durations.

Visualize a scenario where procurement teams can boost efficiency significantly by having accurate service timelines at their disposal. This synchronization ensures that everyone, from procurement officers to backend users, operates with the same timeline data, reducing discrepancies and enhancing planning accuracy. With this new capability, businesses gain a strategic advantage, as coordinated planning between departments becomes the norm rather than the exception.

Think of the impact on your business: with synchronized service data, your teams can efficiently coordinate with service providers, ensuring that every commitment is met with precision. This results in improved operational harmony and more reliable partnerships. This innovative feature boosts your procurement efficiency, aligning strategic objectives with everyday operations. For more details on how this can transform your processes, explore the linked page.  

 

Sales

Enhancing sales efficiency with one-step-payment

In the ever-evolving landscape of digital commerce, SAP Cloud ERP Private now empowers businesses to streamline their sales processes through pre-order payments. This innovation allows customers to make payments even before a sales order is created, seamlessly integrating payment details into the sales order via an API. By carrying over liability and payment details to the finance application, businesses can efficiently match liabilities against payments, simplifying settlements and reducing days sales outstanding (DSO). This enhancement not only enhances liquidity and reduces financing costs but also appeals to customers who prefer paying upfront, offering a more flexible purchasing experience. Furthermore, it facilitates faster incoming digital payments, reassuring customers with the stability and responsiveness of a modern finance system.

Want to learn more about Payment Processing? Check out our SAP Help Portal.

 

Manufacturing

Seamless production alignment with advanced MRP solutions

In a quest to enhance operational efficiency, we are introducing innovative features for Material Requirements Planning (MRP) in Manufacturing area. The Accept MRP Run Result functionality allows production planners to flag specific segments as processed, streamlining decision-making by focusing on issues that truly need attention. This improvement, coupled with the ability to use a new filter field, empowers end users to efficiently analyze material coverage for thousands of materials daily, marking a significant enhancement in workflow efficiency. Additionally, the Manage Material Coverage app now offers rescheduling proposals, enabling planners to realign MRP elements by rescheduling or canceling as necessary. These real-time adjustments ensure that manufacturing requirements are always met as planned, minimizing disruptions and maintaining smooth production flows. With the option to invoke or revoke MRP results, businesses gain flexibility in their planning processes, adapting swiftly to changing demands. Ultimately, this upgrade facilitates a more agile and responsive manufacturing environment, ensuring that production aligns seamlessly with demand predictions.

 

For more details, explore the our dedicated pages on accept planning result of MRP run and rescheduling proposals for MRP elements.    

 

Cross Topics

Enhancing business engagement through integrated communications

With the current release, SAP Cloud ERP Private improves organizations‚Äô ability to craft and deliver personalized, traceable communications seamlessly within their existing workflows. This innovation ensures consistent and timely interactions with business contacts by setting up automated, multi-step communication flows that operate both regularly and in response to specific events. By allowing ad-hoc communications directly from the current process step, businesses maintain critical context without ever leaving the system. This not only enhances productivity and transparency but also significantly boosts customer satisfaction by providing tailored communication that meets the unique needs of each business partner. With these capabilities, organizations can foster stronger relationships industry-wide, ensuring every message is delivered effectively and efficiently.

 

For more insights, please refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Elevating master data governance with Joule copilot

In the quest for seamless data management, SAP introduces an innovation that empowers business users to engage with business partner data through natural language dialogs in Joule Copilot. This advancement provides a consumer-grade user experience, simplifying the processes of searching, displaying, creating, and modifying data within SAP Master Data Governance. By integrating this intuitive interaction capability, users can effortlessly participate in master data processing, enhancing both their effectiveness and the overall speed of data governance. The automation and ease of use offered by Joule Copilot significantly elevate the handling of business partner data, allowing businesses to maintain accurate and timely records with minimal effort. This innovation stands as a testament to the commitment to user-friendly technology that aligns with modern business needs.

 

Simplifying process check complexities with Joule copilot

Moreover, the integration of Joule copilot, helps tackling the complexity of the data governance processes by laying bare with the simplicity of natural language dialog. From now on, users can seamlessly search for and display governance processes in cloud-ready mode, including vital approval information. There's no need for extensive training or additional tools, business users can now harness advanced functions within SAP Master Data Governance intuitively. This empowerment transforms how teams interact with data, enabling them to make informed decisions swiftly and accurately. By simplifying the understanding of governance processes, businesses can ensure compliance and streamline operations.

 

Improved user experience: Seamless navigation with WalkMe integration

Imagine having a virtual guide that not only navigates the complexities of SAP Cloud ERP Private edition but boosts efficiency and confidence. Integrating WalkMe with SAP Cloud ERP Private improves user engagement by offering intuitive in-app guidance akin to a personal assistant, easing the learning curve for new users. This seamless interaction accelerates software adoption, reducing training time and automating repetitive tasks for heightened efficiency. As users navigate system upgrades or new processes, WalkMe‚Äôs role-specific guidance ensures confidence and competence, thereby transforming potential challenges into manageable steps. By providing actionable insights into user behavior, WalkMe empowers users to resolve issues independently, which enhances IT efficiency and reduces support demands.

 

Register for the SAP Business Suite Product Expert Training 2025!

The SAP Business Suite Product Expert Training is a biannual multi-day event designed to empower partners with in-depth knowledge of the latest features and AI-driven innovations. 

For the first time, we‚Äôre covering the full range of SAP Business Suite, incl. topics such as SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), Spend Management, Supply Chain Management (SCM), Customer Experience (CX), Human Capital Management (HCM), and more, setting a new benchmark in SAP training.

Join this event to maximize customer success and stay ahead of the rapidly evolving digital landscape.

  • From October 6-17, we cover SAP Cloud ERP, Cloud LoB, and SAP SCM
  • From October 27-31, we cover SAP Cloud ERP Private, Cloud LoB, and SAP SCM

Check out the detailed agenda on this landing page and register now. Please take into consideration that the registration is available for partners and internal SAP employees only. 

 

Summary

As we explore the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release, it's impressive to see how these innovations integrate advanced technology with intelligent business processes. From enhancing finance management to improving supply chain operations and service quality, these advancements are designed to support companies in the future.

I encourage you to delve deeper into the specific business and industry-focused innovations in upcoming blog posts. Connect with us on our community page to engage with our experts, raise your queries, and share insights.

Stay ahead by following the latest updates with the PSCC_Enablement tag. Don't forget to follow me at BeSchulze in the community and on LinkedIn to catch all the updates and insights.

Together, let's work towards a more connected and efficient ERP future.

Best wishes,
Bert

For more information on how this integration can enhance your organization's user experience, explore the SAP Help Portal.

More information
